FuncDef:
The bandwidth cir command configures a bandwidth profile for an NQA test flow.
The undo bandwidth command deletes a bandwidth profile for an NQA test flow.
By default, no bandwidth profile is configured for an NQA test flow.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the EIR in a bandwidth profile.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the CIR in a bandwidth profile.
The value is an integer ranging from 8 to 10000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A bandwidth profile defines SLA service flow parameters, including the CIR and EIR.
A bandwidth profile must be specified for an Ethernet service activation test. Only after the bandwidth profile is specified, an initiator can construct and send test packets. Upon receipt of the test packets, the reflector calculates parameters, compares them with those in the bandwidth profile, and then determines whether the test is successful and whether the carrier network service deployment and network resources meet requirements for the tested services.
Precautions
This command is only run for an Ethernet service activation test instance.
